back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a single item or person.
back_cards.example_en: I need one more apple for the recipe.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to indicate a specific thing.
back_cards.example_en: This is the one I was talking about.
She ate one slice of pizza.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to emphasize a particular item.
back_cards.example_en: He’s the one who won the race.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to the speaker and others.
back_cards.example_en: She invited us to the party.

back_cards.definition_en: Used as the object of a verb.
Indicates a group including the speaker.
back_cards.example_en: They saw us at the park.
The coach motivated us to win.
He sent us a thank-you note.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to one or some of a thing.

back_cards.example_en: I don’t have any money left.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to any item.
back_cards.example_en: Take any book from the shelf.
Any student can join the club.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to multiple items at a distance.
back_cards.example_en: Those books belong to the library.

back_cards.definition_en: Points to specific things farther away.

back_cards.example_en: He was very tired after work.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a female as the object.
back_cards.example_en: I gave her a new scarf.
Her phone is on the table.

back_cards.definition_en: Used as the object of a verb.
back_cards.example_en: He saw her at the market.
We need to finish this project.
She needs a new coat for winter.
You need to call your mom.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to returning to a place.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll be back in ten minutes.
She stepped back from the edge.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates a return to a state.

back_cards.example_en: There’s a dog in the yard.
There was a delay at work.
You should study for the test.
We should try that new café.
I should call if I’m late.
She shared the candy even with strangers.
This is even better than before.
This is the only way out.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a job or task.
back_cards.example_en: She loves her work as a teacher.
This project took a lot of work.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a product of effort.

back_cards.example_en: Life in the city is busy.
Her life was full of adventure.
He worked hard all his life.
The party was full of life.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a way of living.
Asks for a reason or cause.

back_cards.example_en: Why does the sky turn red?
It’s the right thing to do.
She’s the right person for the job.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a state of being.

back_cards.example_en: The cup is on the table.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to contact with a surface.
To attempt or make an effort.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll try to call you later.
She tried to win the race.
He tried to fix the leak.
Let me help you with that.
She let the kids play outside.
Can you give me something to eat?
I’m going to the party too.
She was tired and hungry too.
He called it a great idea.
The woman helped me find my way.
The women gathered for the event.
May you have a great day.
She may come to the party.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates movement from one side to another.

back_cards.example_en: The river flows through the valley.
What do you mean by that?
Her smile meant she was happy.
I didn’t mean to upset you.
The dog ran after the ball.
After the storm, it was calm.
The world is full of wonders.
She’s new to the world of art.
The world of science is vast.
It’s a problem around the world.
The cat is in the box.
He feels it’s the right choice.
A great tree stood in the park.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows the end of a series.
back_cards.example_en: He was the last to leave.
The child played in the park.
The plane flew over the city.
I was tired when I got home.
He runs as fast as a deer.
As it was late, we left.
The kids go to school daily.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a group or style.

back_cards.example_en: She lives in a big state.
His state of mind is calm.
The state passed a new law.
The house is in a bad state.
How much sugar do you need?
She talks to her friend daily.
The kids are out in the garden.
Keep your keys in your pocket.
They keep food in the pantry.
She left her job last month.
He left his books to her.
Put the book on the shelf.
She put the blame on him.
He put effort into the project.
I put my thoughts in writing.
Put your shoes by the door.
Can you help me with this?
She helped him tie his shoes.
I did it on my own.
Three birds sat on the branch.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to all in a group.

back_cards.example_en: I check my phone every hour.

back_cards.definition_en: To grow into or turn into.

back_cards.example_en: This is the most fun I’ve had.
Split the candy between the kids.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a group of relatives.
Shows a group with shared traits.
back_cards.example_en: Cats are in the feline family.
The bird flew over the lake.
She’s the president of the club.
He’s the old man of the team.
Yes, I’ll come to the party.
The house of Smith is old.
He showed how to fix it.
It was cold, so we stayed in.
He was late, so he ran.
It seems like a good idea.
She might come to the party.
This is part of the puzzle.
She played a part in the play.
Part of the cake is gone.
I read part of the book.
The book has its cover torn.
This is a nice place to relax.
It’s a great place to visit.
We have a problem with the car.
Where there’s a will, there’s a way.
Where did you park the car?
She works five days a week.
It took a week to finish.
The point of the meeting was clear.
She held the cup in her hand.
Can you give me a hand?
He had a hand in the plan.
The project is in good hands.
Wipe the dust off the table.
Turn the wheel to the left.
Let’s turn to the next topic.
I have a few coins left.
Few people came to the event.
She has a few friends here.

back_cards.definition_en: A collection of people or things.
back_cards.example_en: The group met at the park.
A group of birds flew by.
